summary: This is an email chain from March 2021 between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing the compilation of a list of all FOIA requests the office has received related to Jeffrey Epstein and/or Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence involves coordination with the FOIA Office and the Executive Office for United States Attorneys (EOUSA).

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals trying to assemble a list of all FOIA requests related to Epstein and Maxwell received by the SDNY office.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Maurene as trying to assemble the list of FOIA requests related to Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender who is the subject of the FOIA requests being discussed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The convicted associate of Jeffrey Epstein who is also a subject of the FOIA requests being cataloged.

connections.description: Both are named as the subjects of the FOIA requests being tracked by the SDNY, indicating their legal and investigative linkage.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys working together to compile information on FOIA requests related to Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein/Maxwell FOIA list
events.description: Multiple emails are exchanged among SDNY personnel regarding assembling a comprehensive list of all FOIA requests the office has received concerning Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: FOIA Office follow-up
events.description: A response indicates coordination with the Executive Office for United States Attorneys (EOUSA) is ongoing to get an answer regarding the FOIA requests.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively cataloging all FOIA requests it had ever received related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of March 2021.
The FOIA tracking database for the SDNY office was noted as not covering FOIA requests directed to other agencies like the FBI, even if litigation ended up in the SDNY.
The correspondence references a specific missing case: a civil case involving a FOIA request from Radar Online that was not initially captured in their list.
The document reveals internal administrative efforts to track public information requests concerning the high-profile Epstein/Maxwell case.
